title: Morgan Stanley begins Nitro's run at boards
text:
Morgan Stanley has kicked off software company Nitro’s run at the ASX boards, valuing it up to 9.5-times revenue.

Nitro co-founder Sam Chandler. Stefan Postles

In detailed reports sent to fund managers on Monday morning, Morgan Stanley analysts said Nitro was worth $US276 million ($404 million) to $US383 million ($561 million).

The valuation, primarily using a discounted cashflow method, valued the company at 6.8 times to 9.5 times revenue.

IPO contender Nitro writes software to help businesses create, edit, sign and manage digital documents.

Its main competitors are $191 billion giant Adobe and $16 billion dollar DocuSign. Morgan Stanley analysts said this fight against much larger incumbents was one of the key risks facing the business.
description: Morgan Stanley is kicking off digital document software management group Nitro's initial public offering marketing today.
